byline.contributor: Andrew E. Kramer reported from Moscow, and Dan Bilefsky from London.
byline.original: By ANDREW E. KRAMER and DAN BILEFSKY

abstract: Dutch team investigating 2014 loss of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 over Ukraine say they have found what might be pieces of Russian-made surface-to-air missile system in eastern Ukraine.
lead_paragraph: The revelation is significant as the first from Dutch investigators to link physical evidence with a specific type of missile system, a Russian-made Buk surface-to-air system.

headline.main: Malaysia Airlines Crash Investigators May Have Found Missile Clues in Ukraine
headline.print_headline: Dutch Team Investigating Loss of Jet Over Ukraine May Have Found Missile Clues

snippet: The revelation is significant as the first from Dutch investigators to link physical evidence with a specific type of missile system, a Russian-made Buk surface-to-air system.
